    Data LossÂ¶

    Data loss : Model predictions should match training data. Loss over the dataset is an average of loss over examples:

    Least Squares Error, LSE, L2-loss â€”â€” conditional meanÂ¶

    Li=(Yiâˆ’f(Xi;Î¸))2L_i=(Y_i-f(X_i;\theta))^2 Liâ€‹=(Yiâ€‹âˆ’f(Xiâ€‹;Î¸))2

    Regression â†’ Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) according to estimation åˆ†ç±»

    Targets: conditional mean â€…â€ŠâŸºâ€…â€Šfâˆ—(x)=E(Yâˆ£X=x)=minâ¡fE{(Yâˆ’f(X))2âˆ£X=x}\iff f^*(x)=\mathbb E(Y|X=x)=\min\limits_f\mathbb E\mathbb\{(Y-f(X))^2|X=x\}âŸºfâˆ—(x)=E(Yâˆ£X=x)=fminâ€‹E{(Yâˆ’f(X))2âˆ£X=x}

    Properties:

    1. differentiable and convex

      Differentiability allows us to take the derivative and locate the minimum point. Convexity allows us to claim a global minimizer (also unique if the objective function is strictly convex).

    2. ä¼šæ›´é‡è§† outliers

    LSE fail with contaminated data

    æ•°æ®å­˜åœ¨ outliers çš„æ—¶å€™å°±å®¹æ˜“ä¸ robust

    • å› ä¸ºå¹³æ–¹æ”¾å¤§äº†å·®åˆ« largeâ†’large2,smallâ†’small2\text{large}\rightarrow\text{large}^2,\text{small}\rightarrow\text{small}^2largeâ†’large2,smallâ†’small2 . å’Œ outlier ç›¸å¯¹åº”çš„ loss å°±ä¼š dominate the empirical risk, åœ¨ regression with outliers é‡Œå°±ä¼šæ›´åå‘ approximate the outliers, the fitted curve has been distorted quite significantly.

    • LSE é¢„æµ‹å‡ºæ¥çš„ conditional meanï¼Œå…¶ä¸­ outlier ç‚¹æœ‰å‚ä¸è®¡ç®—ï¼Œï¼ˆæ¯”èµ· median æ¥è¯´ mean æ˜¯æ›´å®¹æ˜“å—åˆ° outlier å½±å“ï¼Œæ›´ä¸ robust metricï¼‰

    Check Loss function â€”â€” conditional quantileÂ¶

    Which class of data do we care aboutï¼Ÿ We can trace the Quartile

    • proof:

      Assume: - âˆ€x,E[Yâˆ£X=x]<âˆ\forall x, \mathbb{E}[Y|X=x]\lt\infinâˆ€x,E[Yâˆ£X=x]<âˆ (å­˜åœ¨) - FYâˆ£X=x(â‹…):=F_{Y|X=x}(\cdot):=FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(â‹…):= the conditional cdf of Yâˆ£X=x,{cdfÂ ofâˆ’âˆ=0cdfÂ of+âˆ=1cdfÂ ofÂ median=12Y|X=x, \begin{cases}\text{cdf of} -\infin=0\\\text{cdf of} +\infin=1\\\text{cdf of median} =\frac{1}{2}\end{cases}Yâˆ£X=x,â©â¨â§â€‹cdfÂ ofâˆ’âˆ=0cdfÂ of+âˆ=1cdfÂ ofÂ median=21â€‹â€‹

    L(f)=E{ÏÏ„â‹…âˆ¥Yâˆ’f(X)âˆ¥1âˆ£X=x}=âˆ«âˆ’âˆf(x)(Ï„âˆ’1)(yâˆ’f(x))dFYâˆ£X=x(y)+âˆ«f(x)+âˆÏ„(yâˆ’f(x))dFYâˆ£X=x(y)âˆ‚L(f)âˆ‚f=âˆ«âˆ’âˆf(x)(1âˆ’Ï„)â‹…dFYâˆ£X=x(y)+âˆ«f(x)+âˆâˆ’Ï„â‹…dFYâˆ£X=x(y)=(1âˆ’Ï„)FYâˆ£X=x(y)âˆ£âˆ’âˆf(x)âˆ’Ï„FYâˆ£X=x(y)âˆ£f(x)+âˆ=(1âˆ’Ï„)(FYâˆ£X=x(f(x))âˆ’0)âˆ’Ï„(1âˆ’FYâˆ£X=x(f(x)))=SET0â€…â€ŠâŸ¹â€…â€ŠFYâˆ£X=x(f(x))=Ï„â€…â€ŠâŸ¹â€…â€Šf(x)Â isÂ Ï„Â thÂ quantileÂ of\begin{align*}\mathcal{L}(f)&=\mathbb{E}\{\rho_Ï„\cdot\Vert Y-f(X)\Vert_1\vert X=x\}\\&=\int_{-\infin}^{f(x)}(Ï„-1)(y-f(x))\text{d}F_{Y|X=x}(y)+\int_{f(x)}^{+\infin}Ï„(y-f(x))\text{d}F_{Y|X=x}(y)\\\cfrac{\partial\mathcal{L}(f)}{\partial f}&=\int_{-\infin}^{f(x)}(1-Ï„)\cdot\text{d}F_{Y|X=x}(y)+\int_{f(x)}^{+\infin}-Ï„\cdot\text{d}F_{Y|X=x}(y)\\&=(1-Ï„)F_{Y|X=x}(y)\Big\vert_{-\infin}^{f(x)}-Ï„F_{Y|X=x}(y)\Big\vert^{+\infin}_{f(x)}\\&=(1-Ï„)(F_{Y|X=x}(f(x))-0)-Ï„(1-F_{Y|X=x}(f(x)))\xlongequal{SET}0\\\implies & F_{Y|X=x}(f(x))=Ï„ \implies f(x)\text{ is Ï„ th quantile of}\end{align*} L(f)âˆ‚fâˆ‚L(f)â€‹âŸ¹â€‹=E{ÏÏ„â€‹â‹…âˆ¥Yâˆ’f(X)âˆ¥1â€‹âˆ£X=x}=âˆ«âˆ’âˆf(x)â€‹(Ï„âˆ’1)(yâˆ’f(x))dFYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(y)+âˆ«f(x)+âˆâ€‹Ï„(yâˆ’f(x))dFYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(y)=âˆ«âˆ’âˆf(x)â€‹(1âˆ’Ï„)â‹…dFYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(y)+âˆ«f(x)+âˆâ€‹âˆ’Ï„â‹…dFYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(y)=(1âˆ’Ï„)FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(y)â€‹âˆ’âˆf(x)â€‹âˆ’Ï„FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(y)â€‹f(x)+âˆâ€‹=(1âˆ’Ï„)(FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(f(x))âˆ’0)âˆ’Ï„(1âˆ’FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(f(x)))SET0FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(f(x))=Ï„âŸ¹f(x)Â isÂ Ï„Â thÂ quantileÂ ofâ€‹

    FYâˆ£X=x(fâˆ—(x))=Ï„,âˆ€Ï„âˆˆ(0,1)â€…â€ŠâŸ¹â€…â€Šfâˆ—(x)=FYâˆ£X=xâˆ’1(Ï„)F_{Y|X=x}(f^*(x))=Ï„,\forall Ï„\in(0,1)\implies f^*(x)=F_{Y|X=x}^{-1}(Ï„)FYâˆ£X=xâ€‹(fâˆ—(x))=Ï„,âˆ€Ï„âˆˆ(0,1)âŸ¹fâˆ—(x)=FYâˆ£X=xâˆ’1â€‹(Ï„) will be the conditionalÂ ğ‰â€“th quantile ofÂ ğ’€|ğ‘¿Â =Â ğ’™

    Hinge LossÂ¶

    Li=âˆ‘jâ‰ yimaxâ¡(0,sjâˆ’syi+1)L_i=\sum\limits_{jâ‰ y_i}\max(0,s_j-s_{y_i}+1) Liâ€‹=jî€ =yiâ€‹âˆ‘â€‹max(0,sjâ€‹âˆ’syiâ€‹â€‹+1)

    Squared Hinge LossÂ¶

    Li=âˆ‘jâ‰ yimaxâ¡(0,sjâˆ’syi+1)2L_i=\sum\limits_{jâ‰ y_i}\max(0,s_j-s_{y_i}+1)^2 Liâ€‹=jî€ =yiâ€‹âˆ‘â€‹max(0,sjâ€‹âˆ’syiâ€‹â€‹+1)2

    SoftmaxÂ¶

    Li=âˆ’logâ¡(expâ¡(syi)âˆ‘jexpâ¡(sj))L_i=-\log\Big(\cfrac{\exp(s_{y_i})}{\sum\limits_j\exp(s_j)}\Big) Liâ€‹=âˆ’log(jâˆ‘â€‹exp(sjâ€‹)exp(syiâ€‹â€‹)â€‹)

    æ›´å…³æ³¨å°‘è§çš„é”™è¯¯

    Regularization - measure complexity and penalizeÂ¶

    Prevent the model from doingÂ tooÂ well on training data, control å¤æ‚åº¦

    according to problem

    ClassificationÂ¶

    • data: (Xi,Yi),i=1,â€¦,n,XiâˆˆRp,XâˆˆRnÃ—p,Yi(X_i,Y_i),i=1,\dots,n,X_i\in\R^p, X\in\R^{n\times p}, Y_i(Xiâ€‹,Yiâ€‹),i=1,â€¦,n,Xiâ€‹âˆˆRp,XâˆˆRnÃ—p,Yiâ€‹ is categorical

    • Classifier: F={f:f(â‹…)âˆˆdom(Y)}\mathcal{F}=\{f:f(\cdot)\in \text{dom}(Y)\}F={f:f(â‹…)âˆˆdom(Y)}

    Y æ˜¯ç±»åˆ«å±æ€§ without numerical meaningï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åªåœ¨ä¹ whether sample is assigned into the correct label or notã€‚

    å›å½’çš„æ—¶å€™å¤„ç†çš„æ˜¯è¯¯å·®ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥è¦æœ€å°åŒ–ï¼Œè€Œç°åœ¨è€ƒè™‘çš„æ˜¯è”åˆæ¦‚ç‡ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å¸Œæœ›æ¦‚ç‡å°½å¯èƒ½å¤§ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥è¦æœ€å¤§åŒ–

    the number of success é”™æœ‰å¤šå°‘çš„è§’åº¦ ã€‚æˆ‘ä»¬å…ˆæƒ³åˆ°çš„æ˜¯ï¼šIndictor & 0-1 loss

    From 0-1 lossÂ¶

    Empirical Risk with 0-1 Loss . with Yiâˆˆ{âˆ’1,1}Y_i\in\{-1,1\}Yiâ€‹âˆˆ{âˆ’1,1}

    minâ¡fR(f)=1nâˆ‘i=1nI(f(Xiâ‰ Yi))â‡”maxâ¡fR(f)=1nâˆ‘i=1nf(Xi,Î¸)Ã—Yi\min_f R(f) =\cfrac{1}{n}\sum\limits_{i=1}^nI(f(X_iâ‰ Y_i))\Leftrightarrow\max_f R(f)=\cfrac{{1}}{n}\sum\limits_{i=1}^nf(X_i, \theta)\times Y_i fminâ€‹R(f)=n1â€‹i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹I(f(Xiâ€‹î€ =Yiâ€‹))â‡”fmaxâ€‹R(f)=n1â€‹i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹f(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)Ã—Yiâ€‹

    0-1 loss is non-continuous, non-smooth.

    but we expect: <b>continuous, smooth</b>
    ğŸ’¡ <u>Surrogate Loss function ä»£ç†æŸå¤±å‡½æ•°</u>ã€‚Proper surrogate loss function will lead to a consistent classifier.

    Surrogate Loss function ä»£ç†æŸå¤±å‡½æ•° . Li=Ï•(Li)â€˜,:math:L_i=\phi(L_i) ` , :math:Liâ€‹=Ï•(Liâ€‹)â€˜,:math:phi` is continuous and <u>decreasing</u>.

    properties of Ï•(â‹…):\phi(\cdot):Ï•(â‹…):

    1. continuous: èƒ½é€šè¿‡æ¢¯åº¦æ±‚è§£ä¼˜åŒ–

    2. decreasing: f(Xi,Î¸)Yiâ†‘â€…â€ŠâŸºâ€…â€ŠÏ•(f(Xi,Î¸)Ã—Yi)â†“f(Î§_i,\theta)Y_i\uparrow\iff \phi(f(X_i,\theta)\times Y_i)\downarrowf(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)Yiâ€‹â†‘âŸºÏ•(f(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)Ã—Yiâ€‹)â†“

      {Yi=+1â†’forcef(Xi,Î¸)>0â†‘â€…â€ŠâŸ¹â€…â€ŠYi^=+1Yi=âˆ’1â†’forcef(Xi,Î¸)<0â†“â€…â€ŠâŸ¹â€…â€ŠYi^=âˆ’1\begin{cases}Y_i=+1&\xrightarrow{\text{force}} f(X_i,\theta)>0\uparrow\implies\hat{Y_i}=+1 \\Y_i=-1&\xrightarrow{\text{force}} f(X_i,\theta)<0\downarrow \implies \hat{Y_i}=-1\end{cases}{Yiâ€‹=+1Yiâ€‹=âˆ’1â€‹forceâ€‹f(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)>0â†‘âŸ¹Yiâ€‹^â€‹=+1forceâ€‹f(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)<0â†“âŸ¹Yiâ€‹^â€‹=âˆ’1â€‹

    Empirical Risk with 0-1 Loss

    Empirical Risk with Surrogate Loss Function

    maxâ¡fR(f)=1nâˆ‘i=1nf(Xi,Î¸)Ã—Yi\max_f R(f)=\cfrac{{1}}{n}\sum\limits_{i=1}^nf(X_i, \theta)\times Y_imaxfâ€‹R(f)=n1â€‹i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹f(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)Ã—Yiâ€‹

    minâ¡fR(f)=1nâˆ‘i=1nÏ•(f(Xi,Î¸)Ã—Yi)\min_f R(f) =\cfrac{1}{n}\sum\limits_{i=1}^n\phi(f(X_i,\theta)\times Y_i)minfâ€‹R(f)=n1â€‹i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹Ï•(f(Xiâ€‹,Î¸)Ã—Yiâ€‹)

    Loss Function

    0-1 loss:

    I(â‹…)I(\cdot)I(â‹…)

    I(yâ‹…f(x,Î¸)<0)I(y\cdot f(x,\theta)<0)I(yâ‹…f(x,Î¸)<0)

    Exponential loss

    eâˆ’(â‹…)e^{-(\cdot)}eâˆ’(â‹…)

    eâˆ’yâ‹…f(x,Î¸)e^{-y\cdot f(x,\theta)}eâˆ’yâ‹…f(x,Î¸)

    (AdaBoost)

    Logistic loss

    logâ¡{1+eâˆ’(â‹…)}\log\{1+e^{-(\cdot)}\}log{1+eâˆ’(â‹…)}

    logâ¡{1+expâ¡(âˆ’yâ‹…f(x,Î¸))}\log\{1+\exp(-y\cdot f(x,\theta))\}log{1+exp(âˆ’yâ‹…f(x,Î¸))}

    Hinge loss

    maxâ¡{1âˆ’(â‹…),0}\max\{1-(\cdot),0\}max{1âˆ’(â‹…),0}

    maxâ¡{1âˆ’yâ‹…f(x,Î¸),0}\max\{1-y\cdot f(x,\theta),0\}max{1âˆ’yâ‹…f(x,Î¸),0}

    (SVM)

    The Likelihood ä¼¼ç„¶çš„è§’åº¦Â¶

    The Likelihood Function

    [P(Yi=(1,0,...)âˆ£Xi=x)]I(Yi=(1,0,...))Ã—â‹¯Ã—[P(Yi=(0,...,1)âˆ£Xi=x)]I(Yi=(0,...,1))=âˆj=1#category[P(Yi=jâˆ£X=x)]I(Yi=j)=[yi1^]I(Yi1=1)Ã—[yi2^]I(Yi2=1)Ã—â‹¯Ã—[yij^]I(Yij=1)Ã—â€¦,{yi^=(yi1^,...,yij^â€¦â€‰)yij^=P(Yi=jâˆ£X=x)yij^âˆˆ[0,1],âˆ‘j=1myij^=1=[y^i1]Yi1Ã—[y^i2]Yi2Ã—â‹¯Ã—[y^ij]YijÃ—â€¦,Yijâˆˆ{0,1}:=Xiæ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å±äºjç±»\small{[P(Y_i=(1,0,...)|X_i=x)]^{I(Y_i=(1,0,...))}\times\dots\times [P(Y_i=(0,...,1)|X_i=x)]^{I(Y_i=(0,...,1))}}\\=\prod\limits_{j=1}^{\text{\#category}}[P(Y_i=j|X=x)]^{I(Y_i=j)}\\=[\hat{y_{i1}}]^{I(Y_{i1}=\red{1})}\times[\hat{y_{i2}}]^{I(Y_{i2}=\red{1})}\times\dots\times [\hat{y_{ij}}]^{I(Y_{ij}=\red{1})}\times\dots, \red{\begin{cases}\hat{y_i}=(\hat{y_{i1}},...,\hat{y_{ij}}\dots)\\\hat{y_{ij}}=P(Y_i=j|X=x)\\\hat{y_{ij}}\in[0,1],\sum\limits_{j=1}^m\hat{y_{ij}}=1\end{cases}}\\=[\hat{y}_{i1}]^{Y_{i1}}\times[\hat{y}_{i2}]^{Y_{i2}}\times\dots\times [\hat{y}_{ij}]^{Y_{ij}}\times\dots,\qquad \red{Y_{ij}\in\{0,1\}:=X_i\text{æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å±äº}jç±»}[P(Yiâ€‹=(1,0,...)âˆ£Xiâ€‹=x)]I(Yiâ€‹=(1,0,...))Ã—â‹¯Ã—[P(Yiâ€‹=(0,...,1)âˆ£Xiâ€‹=x)]I(Yiâ€‹=(0,...,1))=j=1âˆ#categoryâ€‹[P(Yiâ€‹=jâˆ£X=x)]I(Yiâ€‹=j)=[yi1â€‹^â€‹]I(Yi1â€‹=1)Ã—[yi2â€‹^â€‹]I(Yi2â€‹=1)Ã—â‹¯Ã—[yijâ€‹^â€‹]I(Yijâ€‹=1)Ã—â€¦,â©â¨â§â€‹yiâ€‹^â€‹=(yi1â€‹^â€‹,...,yijâ€‹^â€‹â€¦)yijâ€‹^â€‹=P(Yiâ€‹=jâˆ£X=x)yijâ€‹^â€‹âˆˆ[0,1],j=1âˆ‘mâ€‹yijâ€‹^â€‹=1â€‹=[y^â€‹i1â€‹]Yi1â€‹Ã—[y^â€‹i2â€‹]Yi2â€‹Ã—â‹¯Ã—[y^â€‹ijâ€‹]Yijâ€‹Ã—â€¦,Yijâ€‹âˆˆ{0,1}:=Xiâ€‹æ˜¯ä¸æ˜¯å±äºjç±»

    L(Yiâˆ£Xi)=âˆj=1#category[y^ij]Yij=[y^i1]Yi1Ã—[y^i2]Yi2Ã—â‹¯Ã—[y^ij]YijÃ—â€¦L(Y_i|X_i)=\prod \limits_{j=1}^{\text{\#category}}[\hat{y}_{ij}]^{Y_{ij}}=[\hat{y}_{i1}]^{Y_{i1}}\times[\hat{y}_{i2}]^{Y_{i2}}\times\dots\times [\hat{y}_{ij}]^{Y_{ij}}\times\dots L(Yiâ€‹âˆ£Xiâ€‹)=j=1âˆ#categoryâ€‹[y^â€‹ijâ€‹]Yijâ€‹=[y^â€‹i1â€‹]Yi1â€‹Ã—[y^â€‹i2â€‹]Yi2â€‹Ã—â‹¯Ã—[y^â€‹ijâ€‹]Yijâ€‹Ã—â€¦

    Log Likelihood Function . l(Yiâˆ£Xi)=logâ¡(L(â‹…))=âˆ‘j=1#categoryYijÃ—logâ¡[yij^]=Yi1logâ¡[y^i1]+Yi2logâ¡[y^i2]+â‹¯+Yijlogâ¡[y^ij]+â€¦l(Y_i|X_i)=\log(L(\cdot))=\sum\limits_{j=1}^{\text{\#category}}Y_{ij}\times\log[\hat{y_{ij}}]\\\qquad =Y_{i1}\log[\hat{y}_{i1}]+Y_{i2}\log[\hat{y}_{i2}]+\dots+Y_{ij}\log[\hat{y}_{ij}]+\dotsl(Yiâ€‹âˆ£Xiâ€‹)=log(L(â‹…))=j=1âˆ‘#categoryâ€‹Yijâ€‹Ã—log[yijâ€‹^â€‹]=Yi1â€‹log[y^â€‹i1â€‹]+Yi2â€‹log[y^â€‹i2â€‹]+â‹¯+Yijâ€‹log[y^â€‹ijâ€‹]+â€¦

    Cross EntropyÂ¶

    Cross Entropy Loss . CELossi=âˆ’âˆ‘j=1#categoryYijÃ—logâ¡y^ij\text{CELoss}_i =-\sum\limits_{j=1}^{\text{\#category}}Y_{ij}\times \log \hat{y}_{ij}CELossiâ€‹=âˆ’j=1âˆ‘#categoryâ€‹Yijâ€‹Ã—logy^â€‹ijâ€‹

    Empirical Risk with Cross Entropy Loss . R(f)=1#sampleâˆ‘i=1#sample[âˆ’âˆ‘j=1#categoryYijÃ—logâ¡yij^]=1nâˆ‘i=1n[âˆ’âˆ‘j=1mYijÃ—logâ¡yij^]R(f)=\frac{1}{\text{\#sample}} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{\text{\#sample}}\Big[-\sum\limits_{j=1}^{\text{\#category}}Y_{ij}\times \log \hat{y_{ij}}\Big]=\cfrac{1}{\red{n}} \sum\limits_{i=1}^{\red{n}}\Big[-\sum\limits_{j=1}^{\text{\red{m}}}Y_{ij}\times \log \hat{y_{ij}}\Big]R(f)=#sample1â€‹i=1âˆ‘#sampleâ€‹[âˆ’j=1âˆ‘#categoryâ€‹Yijâ€‹Ã—logyijâ€‹^â€‹]=n1â€‹i=1âˆ‘nâ€‹[âˆ’j=1âˆ‘mâ€‹Yijâ€‹Ã—logyijâ€‹^â€‹]

    {n:=#samples,m:=#catrgoriesYijâˆˆ{0,1},yij^âˆˆ[0,1],âˆ‘j=1myij^=1\begin{cases}n:=\text{\#samples},m:=\text{\#catrgories}\\Y_{ij}\in\{0,1\}, \hat{y_{ij}}\in[0,1],\sum\limits_{j=1}^m\hat{y_{ij}}=1\end{cases}â©â¨â§â€‹n:=#samples,m:=#catrgoriesYijâ€‹âˆˆ{0,1},yijâ€‹^â€‹âˆˆ[0,1],j=1âˆ‘mâ€‹yijâ€‹^â€‹=1â€‹

    é¦–å…ˆå®ƒæ˜¯è”åˆæ¦‚ç‡ã€‚æ¦‚ç‡éƒ½æ˜¯1ä»¥ä¸‹çš„æ•°ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥åƒè”åˆæ¦‚ç‡è¿™ç§æ¦‚ç‡ä¹˜æ³•çš„å€¼ä¼šè¶Šæ¥è¶Šå°ã€‚[æ’å›¾] çš„ç¡®å¦‚æ­¤ã€‚å¦‚æœå€¼å¤ªå°ï¼Œç¼–ç¨‹æ—¶ä¼šå‡ºç°ç²¾åº¦é—®é¢˜â€”â€” ä¸ºä»€ä¹ˆfloat16ä¼šæŸå®³æ­£ç¡®ç‡

    å¯ä»¥è¯´äº¤å‰ç†µæ˜¯ç›´æ¥è¡¡é‡ä¸¤ä¸ªåˆ†å¸ƒï¼Œæˆ–è€…è¯´ä¸¤ä¸ªmodelä¹‹é—´çš„å·®å¼‚ã€‚è€Œä¼¼ç„¶å‡½æ•°åˆ™æ˜¯è§£é‡Šä»¥modelçš„è¾“å‡ºä¸ºå‚æ•°çš„æŸåˆ†å¸ƒæ¨¡å‹å¯¹æ ·æœ¬é›†çš„è§£é‡Šç¨‹åº¦ã€‚å› æ­¤ï¼Œå¯ä»¥è¯´è¿™ä¸¤è€…æ˜¯â€œåŒè²Œä¸åŒæºâ€ï¼Œä½†æ˜¯â€œæ®Šé€”åŒå½’â€å•¦ã€‚
